column4: hi! How do I turn off that f-spot is opened when I connect a camera in XFCE. I got a dialog and misunderstood it so now it opens f-spot which I don't use every time I connect camera. I would like to change it to ignore
system | preferences | removable..., and then in places | <anything> | Edit | Preferences | Media
(there's two places)
in removable I can only turn on and off the command I want to run
so turn it off
I use another program but still f-spot get opened two
so turn it off, and then look at the other spot I mentioned
but i want my command to run, not f-spot
so. check. the. other. spot. I. mentioned.
ok
and then in places | <anything> | Edit | Preferences | Media
don't find this
you mean from thunar, then I get same menu
I said xfce
you might want to check out #xubuntu, they'll probably be a bit more familiar with where autolaunching things are set
if I turn off the importing my command doesn't get run but f-spot opens anyway
so I guess it is gnome thing
you aren't running nautilus for a desktop are you?
try running nautilus from a terminal, and then check the Edit | Preferences | Media thing
i instaleld ubuntu and xubuntu packages and kubuntu packages
(ctrl+c in the terminal, possibly followed by a killall nautilus will kill it off if it starts misbehaving)
nothing there?
found it in gconf-editor some gnome autorun command and I turned it off and now my script runs only
